definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: The Gran Sasso team's result is six standard deviations.
sentences.chinese: 而格朗萨索研究组的结果是六个标准差。

sentences.english: And give two standard deviations from your answer.
sentences.chinese: 从答案里给出两个标准差。

sentences.english: Standard deviations and correlation coefficients for a sample of seven stocks.
sentences.chinese: 一个样本为七支股票的标准差和相关系数。

sentences.english: V. (8). The variation due to deviation of R. V.
sentences.chinese: 对于随机变数标准差大小之变化。

sentences.english: The variation due to deviation of R. V.
sentences.chinese: 对于随机变数标准差大小之变化。

sentences.english: The efficient frontier graph displays standard deviation on the horizontal axis and the asset allocations on the vertical axis.
sentences.chinese: 效率边缘图在横轴显示标准差，在纵轴显示资产配置。

sentences.english: But if I would confine myself just to stocks and bonds, then I would get a much higher standard deviation.
sentences.chinese: 但若组合里只有股票和债券，我的标准差会高得多。

definition: to fit (data to a model)/a (close) fit
